page.title: 06Parish Council
page.content: Brierley-Grimethorpe Town Council formed from the former Parish Council in 1974.The council has 13 members,10 from Grimethorpe and 3 from Brierley. The Council has carried out many enviromental improvement schemes to turn waste ground into flower beds, provide seats and hanging baskets on lamp posts in Summer.A stream has been dammed to create a lake for fishing,a nine hole golf course created. The Welfare Hall is owned by the Council and is used by many groups- hired for various activities,weddings, dances etc. as well as by some of our senior citizens. Allotments are owned by the Council as well as the Welfare park and childrens play area. The village has done well in competitions for Enviromental Improvements,Happy Village,and Tideness.
